text: Mary Gloria Wilson Lawson was Louisiana’s first African American female lawyer. She was the Southern University Law School’s first African American female law graduate. On June 12, 1956, Lawson became the first African American female admitted to practice law in Louisiana. Instead of practicing, however, she became a law librarian for the Southern University Law School. == See also == * List of first women lawyers and judges in Louisiana == References == Category:Louisiana lawyers Category:American women lawyers Category:Women librarians Category:Law librarians Category:Southern University Law Center alumni Category:American librarians
title: Mary Gloria Lawson
